decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoListParagraph" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The
proposed rear dormer by reason of its excessive scale and insufficient set
backs, would give rise to an unsympathetic, incongruous, bulky, obtrusive form
of development which would fail to respect the character, composition and
design of the host and neighbouring properties and would significantly detract
from the established and prevailing pattern of development in the area, to the
detriment of the character and appearance of the host building and those
surrounding. The proposal is therefore contrary to the high quality design
aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D1 and
D3 of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy
(2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan
(2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design
Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p><span lang="EN-US" style="line-height: 115%;">The applicant </span><span style="line-height: 115%;">h</span><span lang="EN-US" style="line-height: 115%;">as failed to submit a Flood Risk Assessment and
has therefore failed to demonstrate that the proposed development would not
exacerbate the risk of flooding within the site or increase the risk and
consequences of flooding elsewhere as&nbsp;</span>the proposed Compensatory Flood Storage has no
connectivity with floodplain and it should be moved closer to the dwelling, contrary to the National Planning Policy
Framework (2023), policies SI12 and SI13 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy
CS1 U of Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and policies DM9 and DM10 of the Harrow
Development Management Polices Local Plan (2013).</p>
description: Single storey rear extension; wrap-around rear dormer and two rooflights in front roof slope
